intro: Pseudocalyx africanus, commonly known as the African pseudocalyx, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its showy, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in woodland and shrubland habitats, thriving in well-drained soils. The leaves are usually elliptical and have a smooth texture, while the plant can reach heights of up to 2 meters.
